Canada Child Benefit (CCB) includes Canada Child Benefit monthly amount, and Ontario Child Benefit monthly amount. Tax Year 2020: https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/child-family-benefits/child-family-benefits-calculator.html (accessed July 18, 2022).

Based on net annual income. GST/HST is issued on a quarterly basis, but calculated on a monthly basis. Figures derived from GST/HST and related provincial programs calculator. Tax Year 2020: https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/child-family-benefits/child-family-benefits-calculator.html.  (accessed July 18, 2022)

Ontario Trillium Benefit (OTB) includes Ontario Energy and Property Tax Credit, the Northern Ontario Energy Credit, and Ontario Sales Tax Credit. Based on average market apartment rental rates for Toronto (see k) and net annual income. Benefit is issued on a monthly basis. Figures derived from Ontario Trillium Benefit and related provincial programs calculator. Tax Year 2020: https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/child-family-benefits/child-family-benefits-calculator.html.  (accessed September 29, 2022)

Childcare expenses can be claimed on income tax as a deduction and may reduce income or result in a credit to families with parents 'occupied'. Scenarios 1, 2, 4: Child Care Fee Subsidy, Calculator. Family income estimated using 'income from employment (row 2)'*12 months. https://www.toronto.ca/community-people/employment-social-support/child-family-support/child-care-support/child-care-fee-subsidy-calculator/  (accessed September 13, 2022).

Scenario 3: Before and after home childcare for school year (~194d) + full day home care for PA days, school breaks (summer, winter, March, ~56d). Assumes 10d parental care. Toronto home childcare fees: https://www.toronto.ca/community-people/children-parenting/children-programs-activities/licensed-child-care/toronto-early-learning-and-child-care-services/early-learning-child-care-centres/ (accessed September 9, 2022).

Scenarios 1: two adult transit passes with Fair Pass discount + student transit pass; Scenarios 2 & 3: car + adult transit pass with Fair Pass discount + student transit pass; Scenario 4: adult transit pass with Fair Pass discount + student transit pass; Scenarios 5, 6: adult transit pass with Fair Pass discount; Scenario 7: senior transit pass; Scenario 8: car + adult transit pass with Fair Pass discount; Scenario 9: car - TTC fares and passes https://www.ttc.ca/Fares-and-passes (accessed September 9, 2022). Estimated car expenses using Ontario Living Wage Network 2022 framework adjusted for average cost of gas July 2021-June 2022 (accessed October 4, 2022)

Field Name: Scenario 1: Family of Four, Ontario Works
Description: 2 adults (male and female ages 31-50), 2 children (girl age 8, boy age 14); Ontario Works (OW)

Field Name: Scenario 2: Family of Four, Full-Time Minimum Wage Earner
Description: 2 adults (male and female ages 31-50), 2 children (girl age 8, boy age 14); income is based on one minimum wage earner, 40hr/wk, $15.00/hr (minimum wage in May 2022).

Field Name: Scenario 3: Family of Four, Median Income
Description: 2 adults (male and female ages 31-50), 2 children (girl age 8, boy age 14).

NOTE: Income from employment is based on median after-tax income- couples with children; however, EI and CPP contributions are calculated using median total income- couples with children. Assumption of a dual income family with a split of 65% / 35% between partners.

Field Name: Scenario 4: Single Parent Household with 2 Children, Ontario Works
Description: 1 adult (female age 31-50), 2 children (girl age 8, boy age 14); Ontario Works.

Field Name: Scenario 5: One person Household, Ontario Works
Description: 1 adult (male age 31-50); Ontario Works.

Field Name: Scenario 6: One Person Household, Ontario Disability Support Program
Description: 1 adult (male age 31-50); Ontario Disability Support Program (ODSP).

Field Name: Scenario 7: One Person Household, Old Age Security/Guaranteed Annual Income Supplement
Description: 1 adult (female age 70+); income based on Old Age Security and Guaranteed Income Supplement (OAS/GIS).

Field Name: Scenario 8: Married Couple, Ontario Disability Support Program
Description: 2 adults (male and female age 31-50); Ontario Disability Support Program.

Field Name: Scenario 9: Single Person Household, Full-Time Minimum Wage Earner
Description: 1 adult (female age 19-30); income is based on one minimum wage earner, 40hr/wk, $15.00/hr (minimum wage in May 2022).
